metadata.dc:author: Vargas, L
Díaz-Nájera, A
metadata.dc:description: The entomological resources utilized for a better understanding of Onchocerca volvulus transmission are discussed in this paper. Vector density, anthropohilia, gonotrophic cycyle, parous condition longevity and probability of survival in days after the infectious meal are assessed here in order to integrate an overall picture. The concept of vectorial capacity is developed stressing the quantitative aspects. Parasitism of the black-flies by filariae that are doubtfully identified as O. volvulus is also mentioned here.
metadata.dc:title: Entomologic considerations in the study of onchocerciasis transmission.
